subtitleNullable: AFAC2023 - Financial Data Understanding - Pet Age Estimation
descriptionNullable:
Participants in this task are expected to estimate the age of pets through pictures of their faces based on computer vision technology.

(1) This competition takes **pet dogs** as the data set, which is divided into **training set**, **verification set** and **test set**.

The training set and validation set are noisy data sets with noise content of about **6%**, that is, about **6%** of the data labels may be incorrect. The test set contains no noise.

| dataset | size |
| --- | --- |
| trainset | 20000 |
| valset | 3000 |
| testset | 3000 |

Since the life of pet dogs is generally about 15 years (not more than 16 years), the age label range is [0, 192).

(2) An indication of the pet's age

The age of the pet dog is given by month of age.

(3) Pet dog example diagram

![Pet dog example diagram](https://storage.googleapis.com/kaggle-datasets-images/3558012/6197730/0d8a87b6ff6ea502fbdc8b146d6440de/dataset-cover.png?t=2023-07-26-10-05-41)

(4) Data file

Folder structure for data sets and labels:

```
images
         000000.jpg ......
annotations
         train.txt
         val.txt
```

Label format description:

train.txt is used as an example. The format of val.txt/test.txt is consistent with that of train.txt.

```
image_name\tage_month
000000.jpg   5
000001.jpg     2
000002.jpg   56
 ...           ...
```

Note: The dog in the picture is 5 months old. By analogy.
